page.title: 09History (6)
page.content: St Peter's Church, Thorington. At the west end is a partly Saxon round tower in uncoursed flint with round headed arcading an windows in the upper section. The church is pre-conquest in origin with a narrow nave and chancel. The nave was later widened by reducing the wall thickness inside to a height of two metres, thus adding 50 cms to the width. St Peter's Church Wenhaston Almost the whole church is built of flint, with some of the facings being knapped. The major construction is 14th century, but there are portions of the nave dating back to the late 11th c. The great feature of the church is the painted medieval Doom(judgement scene) on board. Fine Stuart pulpit.
